title: Anyone get the feeling that everything does more damage?
body: I mean ***everthing***. It feels like everything from mages to fighters to ADCs all do noticeably more damage. Not sure if its defenses lacking, new runes being too strong, or a combination but I feel like damage is off the charts right now

replies.body: nope, i feel i do less damage in the sup role, but far more damage in mid tho
Same. I play a lot of supports, but it feels like enchanters such as Janna doesn't do damage anymore. I used to play her AP route but now I guess she's more limited to maxing E support again.
When has Janna ever done damage?

> [{quoted}](name=SpecterVonBaren,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kEG7V72u,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-11-09T03:05:57.236+0000)
>
> When has Janna ever done damage?

Anyone can do damage with Coup De Grace, it's almost 4x stronger than Executioner, and you get 9 AD after you get a kill.

Also remember dangerous game? Yeah, the version now is called 'Triumph' and gives 15% +gold on kill.
Say what you just said but to the person I was replying to
Season 2... She used to be played AP Top... Good memories!

U'd be surprised of the damage Janna could do especially after the Movement speed to damage change. But now feels like it's not really worth investing in damage path so I'm going with a safer support route.
That's funny, as Sona, I feel like I do way more damage than I used to, and I don't even build AP items besides Athene's and a lategame Tear upgrade.

Simple explanation:

While the rune system does have less raw % damage (So you're hitting tanks not quite as hard), you've likely lost a ton of armor/mr/HP you took in your blue and yellow runes. 

This means that if you're not a tank who is actively itemizing for defense, you're probably squishy because your only defense options are what you get from leveling up. As you'd expect, you don't get a lot from leveling up. 

It's not that Riot buffed damage output, they nerfed/didn't compensate for the loss of defense in the runes unless you go tank. (Even then your defensive options are limited to the Armor +5%/MR +5%/ MR and Armor +5% after 10 minutes rune)

Less raw % damage?
But the tree gives like 30+% attackspeed, 12% damage from press the attack, X % from coup de grace, cut down or last stand. No it's more % !

This is true. 

That said, if you look at the old masteries, you'd get around 12% (sometimes more) more frequently and just for hitting someone. That's not to mention the heavy amount of free armor pen you also go.
100% this. It just feels worst because of the heavy lost of defences options for everyone. Which is good and bad honestly.
tanks have been under whelming since mid s3, dmg has been too high for a long time.
Tanks were extremely strong this season. There was also Cinderhulk meta
you mean a couple of jungle tanks were viable and every top lane tank still being unviable outside of the ones riot completely broke with the rework?
Yeah I always see people say "tanks" were strong. I saw like 3 strong tanks {{champion:113}} {{champion:31}} etc., and that had more to do with the champs themselves not the class as a whole.
And I always see people say "adcs" are strong when there's only like 2-3 outliers and the rest are pretty mediocre. No one's complaining that Ashe or Corki is OP, it's all Tristana, Kog and Twitch.

And Xayah, and Varus, and Vayne, and Caitlyn after the butcher Nerf has been relieved.. Jinx would compete damage wise but no reason to pick her over Tris who has more safety. Corki does magic damage now so not even an ADC anymore and Ashe doesn't have the normal interaction with crit, that's why she is fine and not blowing up everything

Okay if we're gonna like B tiers or 1 patch wonders, then include Poppy, Maokai, Zac, Singed

It's all equal.
Xayah and Varus have been consistently picked at worlds, I wouldn't call them B tier.. Even Vayne, a traditionally very bad pick in competitive, got picked.. that should say a lot about her strength.

{{champion:57}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:27}} {{champion:3}} 

What are you talking about?
singed is not a tank nor is cho'gath, malphite hasn't been strong for god knows how long and galio was only strong in competitive.
Riot is literally just keeping tanks and ADCs broken and just rotating a few in and out for the past few years.
Let's be fair. Top lane champs as a whole have been shat on for a while.
Only 2 or 3 "tanks" were even viable while the rest were in the dumpster, wtf are you talking about?

{{item:3076}} {{item:3075}} {{item:3194}} {{item:3193}} "tanks have been under whelming"

This was cycled in from this: {{item:3068}} {{item:3025}}
Literally every champ got some kind of "buff" whether it was base attack damage or base health or some bullshit, and now with preseason, the game's fucked up and broken.
That part wasnt a buff. They were just replacing stats lost with the changes

But they never gave armor or mr to some champions nor did they do much. Since, where is the magic penetration runes the lethality runes etc. They buffed items for nothing. It won't compensate for that, it only forces you to buy items that you would have not in the first place.
Except multiple champions got completely dicked on and lost stats or weren't compensated for some.

I like the runes as a concept, but this has been the problem that the overwhelming majority of the playerbase has been talking about for 3 straight seasons now... damage creep is out of hand.  

Playerbase:  _"Damage creep is getting just a bit out of hand Riot"_

Riot:  _"You're right, we hear you"_

[A few patches later Riot nerfs lethality and makes most assassins---the class that should be doing damage---ineffective but turns Vayne into a complete assassin with the introduction of a new item (Duskblade)]  

Playerbase: _"Damage is still out of hand, except for the one class that should have burst actually doesn't, and the other class (mages) that should be able to have time to react and get off a couple of spells before they are instagibbed can't do that either... DAMAGE ACROSS THE BOARD IS TOO HIGH"_ 

Riot:  _"Okay, okay... we got this... Hmmm... how can we fix this?"_

[A season or so later] 

Riot:  _"We've got it!  You know how you guys hate the runes/mastery system?"_

Playerbase:  _"Uh, I guess?"_

Riot:  _"Well, check this out we're giving you a new mastery system!"_

Playerbase: _"Well... I guess that's okay, but..."_

Riot:  _"Yeah, it's totally swell, keen, boss and all the other terms you kiddos are using nowadays to express happiness and enthusiasm!"_

Playerbase:  _"Yeah... but... the dama..."_

Riot:  _"We're gonna roll it out in preseason with a bunch of other changes that are really awesome that you didn't ask for, but make the game and your account so much more exciting!"_

Playerbase:  _"Okay, but see there's still..."_

Riot:  _"And we've given you even more ways to customize your playstyle!"_

Playerbase:  _"Yeah, that's really nice, but there's still the issue of..."_

Riot:  _"OH!  And did we mention we added some runes that do EVEN MORE DAMAGE?!?!"_

Playerbase:  _[facepalm]_
They are kinda crippling tanks a bit now so that you don't get a tank meta, hope this doesn't lead rise to any other meta.
... Or singularities like a "Vayne" meta or something like that.

> [{quoted}](name=Suitaro,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kEG7V72u,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-11-08T21:03:37.118+0000)
>
> ... Or singularities like a "Vayne" meta or something like that.

Just had a vayne tumble and 1 auto did 3/4 my hp...
They really aren't crippling tanks. Not as hard as they've always been. Bruisers get off much worse.
Runes for tank arent so useful
Maybe not, but, they're better off than bruisers.

Tanks are better tanks
Assasins are better bursters
ADCs are more dps.

Everything else kinda got shafted
Many mages didn't really benefit from this. Most of them don't have a good keyrune for them, while ADCs and assassins have at least 2 options. The only mage who seems to be fairing super well is Malz, who's been good for a while.

Juggernauts either end up being too squishy so they can actually do dmg, or being full-time tanks that get kited hard.

I'm not finding everything does more damage. In fact, I'm finding the opposite is true regarding Keystones.

I find I do less damage with Predator (Very High Cooldown) and Comet (misses, reliance on being in a lane), than I ever did with Thunderlord's. I haven't tried Electrocute yet, but the tallies I've seen on O suggest it ends up doing less than Thunderlord's did in an average game as well.

Dark Harvest is turning out to be a joke; Junglers who use it don't gank much at all, and those who do are underwhelming. 
Aery's shield and damage seems to be average at best as well.

It seems like the only runes that are probably going to influence the game are the ones that indirectly impact damage though situational damage boosts/attack speeds, because that's what makes champs like Xin or an adc reliable.

I haven't seen an absolute blowout either.

Tbh, the most powerful runes I'm finding atm are Taste of Blood and Ravenous Hunter, which FINALLY puts a version of spell vamp back in the game (or more reliable life steal). Everyone now has 'Access' to sustain, and that's awesome, BUT..... I suspect it could also be dangerous to balance..... Someone like Darius could considerably be stronger with all that life restoration.

>I find I do less damage with Predator (Very High Cooldown) and Comet (misses, reliance on being in a lane),

My experience so far, Press the Attack (Precision Key) seems to blow everything out of the water.

- Aiery's Combined damage and shielding Barely exceeds the proc damage (Tested on Lulu who's passive procs the Rune cat).
- Comet roughly matches the proc damage (Tested on Morg with ~80% accuracy according to the tooltip).
- Electrocute falls short of all 3 (Haven't used personally).
- Cheap shot *may* be relevant on Morg + Rylai's; I'm lucky to break 300 a game on anyone else.
- After-Shock Inconclusive. Used it twice, haven't seen anyone else use it yet.
- Haven't seen or Used Dark harvest Yet.

At a glance, this seems fine. The problem is Presses' "+12% increased damage from all sources," Which often matches or just exceeds the proc damage.
So it is effectively doing *double* the damage of everything else.


***Disclaimer:***
1. Hasn't even been 1 day yet; sample size still small.
2. I play on TT, not SR.

i have the same feeling in aram no matter what build i use seems like opponent tank champions tank way more than my tanks with only 2 items and damage better with offensive champions. my tank champions drop like paper
1700 instant damage from a not-even-half-build Wu...
We don't have much resistances in our runes anymore, so stuff does a lot more damage. Sorta sucks for the time being.

I went toplane, enemy toplaner was a 90 armor Tryndamere with grasp of the undying and Doran's shield, I was dealing less than 50% of my aa and skill dmg to someone who was lvl 1 and could heal pretty easily.


Not everyone does more dmg.
Man, I saw a full tank level 18 Cho get shit stomped in 2 seconds flat by a Khazix and Zed earlier. Yeah, the damage is fucking stupid, and tanks are even more worthless than towers are right now.

Laning vs AD champions with 19 armor is so much fun. They totally doesn't nearly oneshot you at level 3. 

Sarcasm aside, I really don't like the reduced resistances. It makes the game way too snowbally and you get punished extremely hard if the enemy jungler pulls off a successful gank. It's a big mistake to only give early lethality/magic pen to champions with mobility too, in my opinion.
I feel like poke supports are incredibly more obnoxious now without sustain supports...

yes i racked up about 16k in damage with a nami.. i completed the stack for the support item by 10 mins.. used to take about 12.5 mins in a good game.. by the end of the laning phase i was 4/1 as nami.. not that i was going looking to KS.. my Luc just dashed into a Lux/Cait combo.. and i had to clean up the mess after.. 

Im not happy with the changes.. taking away the runes means now until u get some core items u lack the mana regen, armor, MR, ETC.. i found as a morg support mana went VERY fast with the spell thief support item.. i might have to change to the coin..  i dunno.. im still not entirely sure which runes to use.. but ATM im not liking the changes..

Try the mana band/flow (can't remember the exact name) rune for Morgana. Or give Kleptomancy a try, funny enough it solves my mana problems on Sona better than any other rune.
Have a good day
Yes and no.  I feel AD does less damage but AP is doing more.
